com.example.cshare.webservices

Interface UserAPI


  • public interface UserAPI
    Interface that defines the user-related API endpoints.

    Provides endpoints to retrieve user information or to update a profile.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Clara Gros, Babacar Toure

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      retrofit2.Call<User> getUserByID(java.lang.String token, int userID)
      Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's getUserByID request.
      retrofit2.Call<User> updateProfileWithoutPicture(java.lang.String token, int userID, User editProfileForm)
      Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's updateProfile request.
      retrofit2.Call<User> updateProfileWithPicture(java.lang.String token, int userID, okhttp3.MultipartBody.Part profile_picture, java.lang.String roomNumber, java.lang.String campus)
      Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's updateProfile request.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserByID

        @GET(value="user/{id}/")
retrofit2.Call<User> getUserByID(@Header(value="Authorization")
                                                          java.lang.String token,
                                                          @Path(value="id")
                                                          int userID)
        Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's getUserByID request.
        Parameters:
        token - (String) of the form "token eyJ0eXAiOiAiand0IiwgImFsZyI6ICJIUzUxMiJ9" which corresponds to the token of the authenticated user and it is passed in the request header
        userID - an integer that corresponds to the ID of the authenticated user in the url path
        Returns:
        (Call) A Call object containing the user information in a User object
        See Also:
        User, ProfileRequestManager.getUserByID(int)

      • updateProfileWithPicture

        @Multipart
 @PATCH(value="user/{id}/")
retrofit2.Call<User> updateProfileWithPicture(@Header(value="Authorization")
                                                                                     java.lang.String token,
                                                                                     @Path(value="id")
                                                                                     int userID,
                                                                                     @Part
                                                                                     okhttp3.MultipartBody.Part profile_picture,
                                                                                     @Part(value="room_number")
                                                                                     java.lang.String roomNumber,
                                                                                     @Part(value="campus")
                                                                                     java.lang.String campus)
        Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's updateProfile request.

        This method takes a MultipartBody.Part profile picture as argument which means the user wants to update its profile picture

        Parameters:
        token - (String) of the form "token eyJ0eXAiOiAianFsZyI6ICJIUzUxMiJ9", it corresponds to the token of the authenticated user and it is passed in the request header
        userID - (int) corresponds to the ID of the authenticated user in the url path
        profile_picture - (Image) New profile picture of the authenticated user (request body)
        roomNumber - (String) New room number of the authenticated user (request body)
        campus - (String) New campus of the authenticated user (request body)
        Returns:
        (Call) A Call object containing the user information in a User object
        See Also:
        User, updateProfileWithoutPicture(String, int, User), ProfileRequestManager.editProfileWithPicture(User)

      • updateProfileWithoutPicture

        @PATCH(value="user/{id}/")
retrofit2.Call<User> updateProfileWithoutPicture(@Header(value="Authorization")
                                                                            java.lang.String token,
                                                                            @Path(value="id")
                                                                            int userID,
                                                                            @Body
                                                                            User editProfileForm)
        Returns a Call object that contains the response to the API's updateProfile request. The request does not contain a profile picture which means the user only wants to update its room number and/or campus.
        Parameters:
        token - (String) of the form "token eyJ0eXAiOiAianFsZyI6ICJIUzUxMiJ9", it corresponds to the token of the authenticated user and it is passed in the request header
        userID - (int) corresponds to the ID of the authenticated user in the url path
        editProfileForm - (User) Contains the campus, and room number attributes to change (request body)
        Returns:
        (Call) A Call object containing the user information in a User object
        See Also:
        User, updateProfileWithPicture(String, int, MultipartBody.Part, String, String), ProfileRequestManager.editProfileWithoutPicture(User)
